titleStmt.title: O. B. Withers to Beriah Magoffin
CWG8112

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Cadiz Ky
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin

Your Petioner would state that he would be pleased as to be appointed as Surgeon for the Ky volunteers in this section of the state for active service and would respectfully beg &c I have been examined before the army board and passed it and had graduated O B Withers of three schools which will be ford on application

We the undersigned, speaking from a prolonged acquaintance with Dr O. B. Withers- and also having a most thorough knowledge of his Medical abilities would most respectfully recommend him to your "Excellency" as a Gentleman- Physician & Surgeon- and in every way qualified to act in such capacity-
We would further pray you to grant his Petition

Names
Jabez Bingham Capt of State Guard at Wallonia Ky
Isaac Burnett M. D.
R A. Burnett C J C C
John W Gaines Ex Brig General Brigade Command Trigg Christian Todd and Capt Cadiz Home Guard
A. G. Jones M. D.
J B, Wall M. D.
T A Wall Drugist
B J Wall
H. C. Burnett
Names
Jno R Grace P. J. T. C. C
A. B. Dyer clk T. Co. Court
Watson Prescott Col Trigg County Malitia
John J. S. T. C
Jno F Campbell Capt of State Guard Co at Rock Castle
Wm H Martin
1st Lt Cadiz guard
O. B. Withers
Wishing the appointment of Surgeon
Ans.
Sept. 2. 1861
